title: Account Executive - Nordics
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

Transform the communications world!

We’re proud (and excited!) to be transforming the global communications landscape through our Omnichannel Platform-as-a-Service (OPaaS).

  • What’s my job title? Account Executive - Nordics
  • What type of contract will I be on? Permanent
  • Where in the world? Remote from the United Kingdom
  • Working hours? For this role, you will operate within GMT
  • What language(s) will I speak? Fluency in English (Nordic language a plus)

The Role

MessageBird is looking for an Account Executive to sell to high-value prospects and customers. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, sourcing, qualifying, and closing new opportunities. The candidate will be responsible for a specific territory and assigned quota while maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction.

Your hunting ground will be part of the EMEA region and targets include relevant and large Digital Natives (ISVs, SaaS, digital-first companies) and agile Enterprises. With plenty of defined key verticals such as E-commerce, Retail, On-Demand, and Call Centres, new logo wins will be second nature to you.

You’ll report to the Head of Sales and work in close partnership with Solution Engineering, Product Management, Customer Support/Success, Marketing, Legal, and Finance.

In return, you’ll gain access to one of the most fun, open, and ambitious groups of people working in EMEA. We push each other to be our absolute best and are the kind of company that will make you feel happy getting out of bed every morning.


What you’ll do

  • End to end ownership of identifying, creating, developing, negotiating, and closing high-value opportunities positioning our CPaaS Platform to Enterprise Clients
  • Using our world-class solution toolset to help enterprises solve complex problems
  • Own the entire commercial engagement from proposal development, pricing strategy, negotiation to closing
  • Will own forecast and monthly, quarterly commit
  • Work with internal teams in a collaborative manner to execute account-specific sales strategies and also to ensure smooth onboarding of the customers
  • Develop and grow MessageBird visibility and relationships across multiple levels within the customer organisation. Navigate through decision-makers and influencers
  • New customer acquisition and drive new revenue. Employ a solution-selling methodology to facilitate customer evaluations and to help them understand MessageBird’s unique differentiation
  • Keep up-to-date records of Activities, Opportunities, and Accounts in our CRM
  • Be responsible for building and maintaining sufficient pipeline coverage
  • Work diligently with cross-functional teams in Product, Marketing, Support, and Operations to design mutually beneficial contracts to address customer requirements and balance the needs of our business

What you’ll bring

  • 4+ years B2B sales within the B2B Software space
  • Building and maintaining sufficient pipeline coverage
  • Experience selling SaaS solutions to a technical and business audience, building trust and mutual respect with technical customers and peers.
  • Strong understanding of Customer Experience Solutions. Prior experience within CPaaS offerings is very helpful.
  • Experience creating pricing proposals, negotiating terms, and managing the contract process.
  • World-class interpersonal and communication skills. Confident and effective communicator with the ability to influence individuals at all levels
  • Organised and efficient with a self-starter attitude, you love independently tackling challenges and seeing them as opportunities.
  • Full professional proficiency in English, both verbally and written
  • Ability and willingness to travel within the EMEA region

Interview Process

You apply and will hear back from us within a few days. If there’s a fit, the full process is as follows:

↳ [30 mins] Recruiter Screen

↳ [45 mins] Hiring Manager Interview

↳ [60 mins] Presentation with Hiring Manager Regional Sales Leader + [45 mins] Role-Fit Interview with Regional Sales Leader

↳ [30 mins] Bar Raiser with CRO

After each stage, we will try our very best to provide timely (2-3 days) and constructive feedback (where possible).

What You’ll Gain

  • All Remote environment
  • Generous stock options for all Birds
  • Opportunity to work abroad according to our internal policies
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Home office set-up budget
  • State-of-the-art work gear
  • Contribution towards your utility costs
  • The occasional company-wide and team events
  • Learn from hundreds of the best minds in the business
  • Collaborate with diverse colleagues Our amazing team works in close to 40 different locations with almost 50+ nationalities across the board!

LIFTOFF! 🚀

Life at MessageBird

We call ourselves Birds! We work fast, grow fast, build fast and focus on impact. We’re go-getters, industry leaders and roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen kind of people. We’re smart, fast, and hungry. Our potential for growth is limitless.

Ready To Fly?

Our cloud communications solutions make it possible for over 30,000 businesses to instantly connect with billions of devices worldwide, allowing them to speak with their customers in the same ways they talk to their friends.

Wherever and however you do your best work - we’ve got you covered!

We're proud to be an All Remote company nested in flexibility. Our unique and united culture is rooted in our team: a diverse flock of over 550+ Birds who represent 50+ nationalities and counting.

MessageBird is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

Recruitment Privacy Statement:

https://dotcom.messagebird.com/content/MB-recruitment-privacy-notice%202020.pdf

title: Strategic Escalation Operations Manager
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.

The Community You Will Join:

The Trust Defense organization protects, guides, and mobilizes the creation of trust in our community and on our platform. We hire quality talent who embody our company values and hold a steadfast commitment to creating a world where anyone in the Airbnb community can host, travel, and connect with peace of mind.

The Difference You Will Make:

In this role, you will lead and drive high-priority initiatives focused on delivering best-in-class customer experience across operations, product, and cross-functional teams. You will partner closely with a diverse group of stakeholders and technical teams to influence strategy, drive insights, deliver improvements, and scale upstream changes to improve our customer experience.

You will bring life to strategy by driving execution and nurturing relationships amongst a wide range of people and teams. Seeking to learn all you can about the functional, technical, and cultural operation of the Trust team, you’ll provide relevant insights and recommendations in order to produce high impact project outcomes.

The person will bring order, structure, and focused management attention to the customer's challenges and provide recommendations in order to gain complete customer satisfaction. You set the highest standards of quality for your work, and hold yourself and others accountable. You understand the importance of delivering excellent products and services to our community, and you're rigorous about examining and improving your own work to ensure it's always as good as it can be. Even when you're successful, you never stop looking for ways to improve. You pay close attention to details, no matter how small.

  • You bring life to strategy through hands-on execution and owning deliverable outcomes
  • You enjoy translating complex ideas into structured, actionable plans to drive upstream change and innovation to improve the customer experience
  • You can support senior leadership in preparing best-in-class executive presentations, including storyboarding, communicating priorities, gathering inputs, and storytelling
  • You enjoy storytelling through the lens of customer insights, data, and leadership feedback
  • You’re someone who naturally builds trust to help their stakeholders and business partners succeed
  • You have fundamental, conceptional, and working knowledge of theories, practices and procedures within strategic operations
  • You will inform the business on strategic performance metrics, identifying opportunities to improve the customer experience, and driving upstream changes with operations and product leaders
  • You are bias for action in identifying actionable plans from a problem and to deliver outcomes
  • You work independently, with guidance in only the most complex situations.

A Typical Day:

  • Partner with organizational and cross-functional leaders to drive upstream changes to improve user experience
  • Organize and track initiatives, clarify project scopes, proactively manage risks, prioritize tasks, and problem-solve
  • Manage multiple interdependent projects of moderate to high complexity and scope
  • Use data and technical judgment to drive project delivery, challenge proposals, and get buy-in
  • Transform customer pain points and initiatives into compelling storytelling to build awareness and consensus for organizational priorities
  • Summarize findings, options, recommendations, and after action reports
  • Provide process and subject matter advice to senior levels
  • Lead execution against recommendations quickly and with accuracy for leadership strategic initiatives and special projects
  • Drive focus and prioritize, proactively identifying future strategic issues while covering urgent needs in the current state
  • Develop positive, trusting relationships through accountability, consistent, and timely deliverables

Your Expertise:

  • Excellent execution skills in delivering outcomes while managing competing priorities and ambiguity
  • Strong communication skills with experience articulating complex topics to a wide array of audiences
  • An ability to collaborate effectively across disciplines, regions, seniority levels
  • A level of creativity that inspires and influences others to think beyond what they believe is possible
  • Expertise in thinking critically to solve problems and achieve innovative solutions
  • Proven ability to work independently and tolerance for a high level of ambiguity
  • Proven presentation skills regarding complex and sensitive customer issues and ability to query, analyze and draw reasonable conclusions from large data sets.
  • Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills including ability to negotiate on recommendations with both internal and external stakeholders

Preferred experience

  • 7-10 years of experience in (e.g., strategy or operations consulting, project management, technical project management)
  • Proven experience in collaborating and partnering with technical stakeholders, e.g. engineering, product management, technical program management
  • In-depth knowledge of developing executive presentations in Keynote and/or Google Slides
  • Demonstrated ability to identify and resolve issues through effective problem solving skills
  • Proven ability to negotiate skillfully in difficult situations with both internal and external groups
  • Have worked among a global team with competing priorities
  • Prior exposure to technical components of product design, functionality, and operation

Your Location:

This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list. If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.

Our Commitment To Inclusion Belonging:

Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.

We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.

How We'll Take Care of You:

Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits.

Pay Range
$150,000$185,000 USD

title: Senior Salesforce Administrator
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

We're transforming the grocery industry

Instacart is the North American leader in online grocery and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Since 2012, we’ve been working towards creating a world where everyone has access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together.

Groceries delivered to your door in as little as an hour. It seems simple, right? Well, it’s more complex than that. From re-routing deliveries during snowstorms, to connecting customers with coupons and deals for their favorite brands, to updating over half a billion grocery data lines every night...our efforts bring Instacart closer to being the operating system for the grocery industry.

Overview

About the Role

We are currently seeking a Business Systems Administrator to help our sales and support teams fully utilize the Salesforce platform. The ideal candidate would be passionate about building high-quality solutions, motivated to help the teams using those solutions, driven to master their craft by gaining deep technical expertise in all related areas, and excited by adding to the great culture of Instacart!

About the Team

The Business Systems Administrator would work within the Business Systems team. The Business Systems team is responsible for designing, building and maintaining systems and tools used by various operational teams. The team has responsibility for managing multiple third party systems such as Salesforce, Ironclad, ZoomInfo, and Contact Centers as well as many tools built by internal engineering teams.

About the Job

  • Build functionality in Salesforce such as lighting apps, record pages, complex flows, approvals, creating and maintaining custom objects, object relationships, and standard and custom fields.

  • Test, validate, and deploy components.

  • Provide end user support of systems including documentation, training, and best practice

  • Provision users and assign proper permissions.

  • Work as a team with other administrators and software engineers to implement new apps and systems.

  • Evaluate, select, implement, integrate and enhance technology tools used by the partner teams.

  • Contribute consistently and enthusiastically to the administrator team’s capabilities.

About

Minimum Qualifications

  • A drive to be an expert at all things Salesforce.

  • 3+ years of experience in Salesforce administration.

  • Proven ability to work effectively with teams.

  • Proven critical thinking and creative problem solving skills.

  • Integration experience with Salesforce to 3rd party applications.

  • Strong communication skills with both business and technical teams.

  • Relevant Salesforce administration skills: Flows, Lightning experience, Revenue Cloud (CPQ) administration, Marketing Cloud (Pardot), Sales Engagement administration, CRM Analytics administration, Sales Cloud and Service Cloud administration

Preferred Qualifications

  • Querying (SOQL, SOSL) experience

  • Salesforce Connect experience

  • Salesforce certifications: Advanced Administrator and App Builder

  • Ability to read and help diagnose issues in Apex code

Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is remote and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their permanent work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

For US based candidates, the base pay ranges for a successful candidate are listed below.

CA, NY, CT, NJ
$154,000$179,550 USD
WA
$148,000$164,850 USD
OR, DE, ME, MA, MD, NH, RI, VT, DC, PA, VA, CO, TX, IL, HI
$141,000$164,850 USD
All other states

Toast is driven by building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love.

Now, more than ever, the Toast team is committed to our customers. We’re taking steps to help restaurants navigate these unprecedented times with technology, resources, and community. Our focus is on building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love. And because our technology is purpose-built for restaurants, by restaurant people, restaurants can trust that we’ll deliver on their needs for today while investing in experiences that will power their restaurant of the future.

Bready to make a change?

As a Director of Commercialization on the Embedded Finance team, you will set the tone and vision for our embedded finance solutions at Toast. The embedded finance platform is an exciting new extension of the Toast offering, combining best in class financial products built for the restaurant ecosystem. This a high visibility opportunity with direct access to senior Fintech leaders and reports to the VP of Lending and Capital Markets. title: Data Operations Manager
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

OVERVIEW

At Instacart we solve for the customer. That extends beyond the hundreds of thousands of consumers who deliver groceries and to the many leading and emerging consumer packaged goods (CPG) advertisers that want to shape how consumers perceive, shop, and stay loyal to their brands. Instacart’s Brand Partnerships team is focused on serving these clients through our native advertising platform and by providing custom reports to support internal data analytics.

We are looking for a Data Operations Manager - a specialist / expert in Retail data handling, ETL, Data Mining, Data Warehouse Design and Management, Scripting / Programming, Building efficient data pipelines, querying large volume of data to extract actionable analytical insights to join the Media/Advertising Analytics team within the Brand Partnership Universe, that is in the spotlight with focus to turn rich data into actionable insights.

This team is responsible for serving some of the largest advertisers in the world by helping them better understand and improve the performance of their multi-million-dollar media budgets. The DataOps team within Media Analytics plays a crucial role in interfacing Sales, BD Insights, Engineering, Catalog and other Business teams to help roll-out complex data driven projects/implementations that have company wide impact.

This role interfaces across the organization and focuses heavily on technical data handling expertise, XFN collaboration, data management, ETL framework design and improvement, taxonomy enrichment/ maintenance, data quality, data governance, custom reporting, and enriching data. The Data Operations Manager will also work closely with Engineering, Analytics and Product Management teams, in providing actionable insights and support for strategic initiatives along with building powerful tools for taxonomy administration. The scope involves both technically rigorous work, tapping into one of the largest pools of first-party data and 3rd party data in the grocery ecommerce space

ABOUT THE JOB

  • Identify new automation opportunities, design and build new frameworks to support both internal / external data deliveries across various schedules
  • Build strong relationships with Catalog and Ads Engineering to identify erroneous patterns in tooling and reporting, identify bugs in data transformations and rulesets that deteriorate the quality of data and metrics over time
  • Come up with new process and tooling requirements to enhance existing workflows, reduce/eliminate manual intervention, and extract efficiencies in overall execution time / SLAs
  • Create effective and thorough ERDs and BRDs to explain requirements to engineering, provide valuable recommendations to developers on process design and exception handling, identify and provide feedback to UI/UX teams to improve user experience
  • As a custodian of Ads Taxonomy, always advocate and practice high standards and best practices in every delivery, every new design and implementation, to always maintain the highest quality of data
  • Build strong relationships with peers both internally and externally, cross functional collaboration and regular engagement across disciplines is key to identifying new contribution areas and build influence
  • Regularly explore and learn new design principles to identify and extract efficiencies in current ETL pipelines and deployed automation frameworks
  • Contractor Team Management
  • Process unification
  • Facilitate collaboration; communicate and collaborate with other MA, data and BI teams members to enhance the quality of data products
  • Adopting new solutions; frequently test and adopt new solutions and tools to improve deliveries whilst adhering to DataOps best practices
  • Data Governance; Ensure every delivery meets the current data governance and policy guidelines, periodically review data sharing rules, track / report all exceptions created to fulfill JBP and contractual obligations
  • Migration Support
  • Identify address data / process leaks; analyze expensive query plans to identify inefficient joins and data distribution layouts, recommend improvements to increase efficiencies through proven optimization techniques
  • Enforce thorough code reviews, implementation and support documentation, impact analysis, pre/post implementation assessments, and handover summaries

ABOUT YOU

  • 5-7 years of relevant experience in data driven environments
  • Working experience in the retail data industry is highly preferred
  • Proven experience of completing large projects end-to-end, with relevant documentation and handovers
  • Experience working with cross functional teams regularly
  • Must understand large cloud/in-house data warehousing architectures and MPP systems
  • Experience in Performance Tuning and Process Enhancement to migrate existing frameworks to new tech/platforms
  • Working experience moving/manipulating large amounts of data using any ETL, ELT or data transformation work streams. Experience working with ETL/ELT tools - Microsoft SSIS, Azure data factory, or anything similar
  • Working with at least one cloud data architecture - AWS, Azure, GCP, or anything similar
  • Working with at least one cloud based data warehousing platforms - Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Azure DW, Oracle Cloud, Google Big Query, or anything similar
  • Advanced SQL - Joins, CTEs, Window functions, Data aggregation and normalization, Regular Expressions, SCD Type 1 and 2 to handle dimension data
  • Strong understanding of fact and dimension objects
  • Python scripting - Feature engineering, data transformation, data download/upload procedures, experience in using standard and proprietary libraries, creating data pipelines and alerting sub-routines
  • Experience working with any issue tracking system such as Atlassian JIRA or anything similar
  • Experience using GIT and GITHUB
  • Working in an Agile environment and exposure to scrum is preferred
  • Exposure to reporting tools such as Periscope, Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI, Snowsight, Mode, or anything similar is preferred
Instacart provides highly market-competitive compensation and benefits in each location where our employees work. This role is in office and the base pay range for a successful candidate is dependent on their work location. Please review our Flex First remote work policy here.

Offers may vary based on many factors, such as candidate experience and skills required for the role. Additionally, this role is eligible for a new hire equity grant as well as annual refresh grants. Please read more about our benefits offerings here.

For San Francisco, CA based candidates, the base pay ranges for a successful candidate are listed below.
San Francisco, CA
$129,000$143,000 USD

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

title: Principal Data Scientist - Fintech Lending/Capital
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

Toast is driven by building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love.

Toast is looking to expand the Data Science team to deliver new Data Science models to meet Toast Capital/Lending increased demands. As a Principal Data Scientist, you will bring senior data science technical leadership with domain expertise in lending to the Capital Data Science team. An ideal candidate has wealth of experience in banking lending technology or a leading fintech company with substantial depth of expertise and knowledge in lending underwriting, and risk management models.

About this roll* (Responsibilities)

  • Lead the development and implementation of advanced predictive models, to assess credit risk, optimize lending growth, and improve overall portfolio performance.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Risk Management, Product, Engineering, and Business Strategy, to identify opportunities for leveraging data-driven insights to support growth and risk mitigation initiatives.
  • Design, develop, and maintain innovative credit risk and lending growth strategies that align with the organization's objectives, while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
  • Monitor and analyze the performance of existing models and strategies, identifying areas for improvement and implementing data-driven refinements as needed.
  • Present complex data-driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear, concise, and actionable manner, while fostering a data-driven culture within the organization.
  • Mentor and guide junior data scientists, fostering a collaborative environment and promoting the growth and development of the data science team.
  • Stay current with the latest trends and developments in data science, fintech, and credit risk management, continually exploring new methods and technologies to enhance the organization's capabilities.

Do you have the right ingredients*? (Requirements)

  • Advanced degree in quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Financial Engineering or related discipline
  • 8+ years of experience in data science, with a focus on credit risk modeling and lending growth strategies, preferably within the fintech lending space.
  • Proficiency in machine learning, AI, and statistical modeling techniques, with a strong track record of developing and deploying successful predictive models in a business setting.
  • Strong proficiency in Python and SQL and experience with data science libraries and tools such as: Spark, Scala, scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch, XGBoost etc.
  • Familiarity with standard software engineering practices and tools including object-oriented programming, test-driven development, CI/CD, git, task orchestration (Airflow) and AWS tooling
  • Strong understanding of credit risk management, lending practices, and regulatory requirements within the financial industry.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong leadership skills, with experience mentoring and guiding junior data scientists

Bonusingredients*:

Our Spread* of Total Rewards

title: Affiliate Marketing Manager
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

About Us

We help ambitious creators become successful entrepreneurs

Kajabi is an incredible place to work (if we do say so ourselves). We call our customers our Heroes because they are. We celebrate and support every one of them working to create a thriving business based on what they know and share with the world. With our robust product features, Heroes have a single ecosystem in which they can publish, market, and sell online courses, membership sites, communities, and other digital products. Tens of thousands of entrepreneurs rely on Kajabi to build and manage their online businesses, and we are proud to have enabled these entrepreneurs to generate over $5.1 billion in sales from over 70 million customers to date. Kajabi is at another inflection point. With over $100 million in revenue and a significant round of funding that values the company at more than $2 billion, we are writing the next chapter in our journey to build a great, enduring company that redefines the knowledge economy. Learn more at www.kajabi.com.

Affiliate Marketing Manager

The Affiliate Marketing Manager will be responsible for accelerating Kajabi’s growth by revitalizing and expanding our very successful Kajabi Partner program into a world class affiliate marketing capability. Reporting to the VP of Growth Marketing, you will play the leading role in planning and delivery of outstanding campaigns to help our Heroes succeed, recruiting new Heroes to the program, and in establishing new partnerships to help us grow. This is a critical individual contributor role that has all the potential to grow into a team leadership opportunity as the program scales.

The impact you will have

  • Accelerate the growth of our business by developing a steady series of highly effective campaigns that enable existing Partners to find more success in referring new Heroes to Kajabi

  • Build deep relationships with our key Partners (they are Heroes, too!) and recruit new, high impact Heroes to the program

  • Develop an amazing partnership with our product team to create unique opportunities for top Partners to make and deliver on unique and compelling offers to their audience

  • Create a robust partner operations system to ensure we serve all of our Partners well

  • Drive the implementation impact.com and open up new affiliate partnership opportunities to further accelerate our growth

The way we like to work

Kajabi is working hard to build a great, vibrant, high performing marketing team. There are a few key tenets that we care deeply about when we approach our work and we are excited to add people to our team who will always help us to be dramatically better. Some of the most important attributes that you will bring to our team:

  • You are Hero First. We are in constant contact with our Heroes and we thrive on their feedback, questions and ideas because they make Kajabi better for everyone. You are equally enthusiastic about building these kind of connections and truly solving for win/win/win outcomes

  • You get results. You have a strong bias for action and a clear focus on action that moves the needle over the long term. Like us, you value speed and learning because those two things compound quickly to yield more impact and better outcomes. We’d rather use the data we have to make a good decision today and work to get the data we need to make better decisions tomorrow

  • You build strong relationships. You understand the importance of strong relationships across teams, appreciate that we are all humans first, and have a history of getting things done that require moving others to action easily and constructively. You leave work relationships stronger than you found them and help the people around you to keep getting better

  • You know your stuff. Deep understanding and mastery of your work is expected and celebrated. It means you’ll know our Heroes, know the data, understand and craft the story, constantly ask the next question, assume that we can be better and work to make it so

  • You prioritize really well. You make conscious decisions to do fewer things at a given time, really well. You have a track record of saying yes to the right things. You create thoughtful trade-off decisions explicitly and constructively and you communicate clearly what will and will not get done, when

  • You work out loud. You communicate clearly, consistently and proactively. You create consistency, clarity and visibility in how and where information and updates are shared so that the right people always know what is happening and how to find out more. We are mostly remote, so we love Slack, a short, compelling document and a crisp spreadsheet to tell the stories that need telling

Experience that will help

  • You have spent around 5 years driving success in digital affiliate marketing programs

  • You’ve seen the organized chaos of a startup or smaller tech company and know how to create more order and progress

  • You have a history of working happily in broad roles that blend strategic thinking with day to day execution

  • You’re comfortable with impact.com or similar platforms

Kajabi Team Benefits Package

  • Company paid premiums for medical, dental and vision insurance for self and family

  • Company sponsored HSA account

  • Company 401K, 100% match up-to 6% of employee contributions

  • Equity

  • Educational Allowances

  • Fitness incentives package

  • Company funded mental health resources

  • Wellness perks

How To Apply

Sound like a good fit for you? Click apply, below!

  • Remote and local applicants welcome!

  • Links - Send along any links that best showcase your experience, i.e. your portfolio, LinkedIn, blog posts, other writing samples, etc.

The salary range for this US-based role is $112,500-$150,000 + bonus + equity + benefits (health, welfare, retirement, and paid leave). Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries. Actual base salary may vary based upon, but not limited to, internal equity, internal salary ranges, market data, applicant's skills and prior relevant experience, education, certain degrees, training, certifications, geographic location, travel requirements, and business needs.

Kajabi LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

title: Marketing Finance Manager
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we’re building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you’re ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Instacart is a Flex First team

There’s no one-size fits all approach to how we do our best work. Our employees have the flexibility to choose where they do their best work—whether it’s from home, an office, or your favorite coffee shop—while staying connected and building community through regular in-person events. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.

OVERVIEW

We are looking for a Strategic Finance Manager of Marketing to join our team. This role has the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on a fast-growing startup and will be a key business partner to marketing leadership. Along with supporting budgeting and forecasting, you will own the weekly monthly business review processes and partner with key cross-functional stakeholders to uncover business insights and communicate learnings to marketing and finance leadership.

As a Strategic Finance Manager, you have both the ability to operate at the lowest level of detail and consider the big picture to drive strategic and investment recommendations. You have exceptional analytical capabilities, excel in data-driven decision making, and have a track record for driving impact in a rapidly changing environment with limited guidance. This role will report into the Director of Marketing Finance.

ABOUT THE JOB

  • Own the monthly, quarterly and annual Paid Incentives Marketing forecast by leveraging cross-functional partnerships with Marketing Channel Leads, Biz Ops, and Data Science
  • Serve as the direct business partner to the heads of Paid Marketing and Incentive Marketing, and collaborate closely with channel leads to uncover key trends and advise on capital allocation decisions
  • Improve and own the weekly business performance cadence to help identify areas where the business should double-down and inform the weekly forecast
  • Partner with the Biz Ops and StratFin Growth teams on customer engagement and CAC/LTV analyses to guide our acquisition and retention strategies by channel
  • Evaluate new business and marketing opportunities from a finance perspective and provide recommendations to marketing and finance leadership based on ROI, payback, and strategic value
  • Develop, monitor, and drive deeper understanding of our KPIs across the marketing organization and identify opportunities to improve existing reporting processes and key metrics tracking
  • Ad hoc financial modeling and analysis, such as building KPI-based models and using SQL to self-serve data for analyses

ABOUT YOU

  • Bachelor’s degree in Math, Economics, Finance, Business or other related field
  • 6-8+ years work experience in a relevant field with demonstrated financial acumen and a track record of leveraging data for business impact
  • Prior experience in Strategic Finance at a fast-paced, high-growth technology company, and experience with marketing finance and consumer-facing marketplaces preferred
  • Highly proficient in advanced Excel modeling with strong attention to detail
  • Proficient in SQL and experience with Tableau or Mode preferred
  • Knowledge of Adaptive Insights a plus
  • Ability to use data to identify and quantify opportunities for growth or profitability improvement
  • Demonstrated experience thinking strategically about complex business problems, developing frameworks, providing recommendations and executing action plans
  • Polished communication skills and comfort working with internal stakeholders, including senior leadership
  • A self-starter with a positive attitude and ability to work in a rapidly changing environment

OVERVIEW

The Cloud Foundations team at Instacart owns the foundational infrastructure that our Engineering teams use to run software services. This includes our public cloud providers, internal networking, secrets management, observability (logs metrics), along with IAM and our Infrastructure as Code platform. This team also provides the tooling for ongoing economic analysis and optimization of our cloud spend. Instacart is a cloud-native company, so this team’s work is at the heart of everything we do.

Developers on the Cloud Foundations team work hand in hand with teams all over the company, building the next generation of grocery technology at the heart of our business.We’re excited to hire an engineer who wants to solve problems with software, and build the best possible foundation for Instacart’s critical services!

As a Staff Software Engineer on the Foundations team, you’ll drive the vision and delivery of our next-generation observability platform. You’ll help us efficiently scale our logging and metric infrastructure, and build new auto scaling strategies to seamlessly manage our compute capacity across diverse hardware families and CPU architectures. You’ll also:

  • Enable the evolution of our Infrastructure as Code platform with new automation and investments in cost efficiency, leveraging ML to avoid common pitfalls and expedite building services.

Toast is driven by building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love. And because our technology is purpose-built for restaurants, by restaurant people, restaurants can trust that we’ll deliver on their needs for today while investing in experiences that will power their restaurant of the future.

Bready* to make a change?

The IT Networking Manager at Toast will manage and maintain all office network infrastructure at multiple locations and this includes planning, developing, installing, configuring, supporting, and optimizing all network hardware, software, and communication links.

About this roll* (Responsibilities):

  • Develop, support and implement network standards, processes and security to maintain reliable network infrastructure
  • Create technical support documentation for systems and applications, including disaster recovery and back-up policies
  • Install, configure, and maintain all Routers, switches and other networking equipment.
  • Evaluate, design and maintain all WAN/LAN network equipment for new and existing sites
  • Conduct feasibility studies on strategic and tactical network plans
  • Analyze project needs/requirements and recommend systems to enable enterprise integration of network systems and hardware
  • Maintain and communicate project plans and status updates
  • Training and mentoring to develop junior members of the team and other technical resources
  • Interface with equipment vendors and service providers to obtain system configurations, quoting and support.

Do you have the right ingredients*? (Requirements)

  • 5+ years of corporate IT network and infrastructure engineering experience
  • Working knowledge of cloud platforms experience building a high availability infrastructure (Cisco Meraki Dashboard a plus)
  • Experience designing and optimizing corporate wi-fi networks
  • Experience with LDAP, keystores, security certificates, user and password management
  • Strong fundamentals in information security especially around identity, authz, authn, and data management
  • Experience collaborating, publishing and enforcing compliance and risk policies (e.g. SOC2, PCI, SOX)
  • Hands-on technical troubleshooting capabilities
  • Familiarity with server management and monitoring tools
  • Exceptional critical thinking and problem solving ability
  • Strong interpersonal skills to assist non-technical individuals with complex technical issues

Our Spread of Total Rewards

We strive to provide competitive compensation and benefits programs that help to attract, retain, and motivate the best and brightest people in our industry. Our total rewards package goes beyond great earnings potential and provides the means to a healthy lifestyle with the flexibility to meet Toasters’ changing needs. Learn more about our benefits at https://careers.toasttab.com/toast-benefits.

*Bread puns encouraged but not required

$96,000$154,000 USD

We are Toasters

Baking inclusive principles into our company and diversity into our design provides equitable opportunities for all and enhances our ability to be first in class in all aspects of our industry.

title: Technical Lead- Staff Software Engineer
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

Bready* to make a change?

Toast is scaling rapidly, and with that growth comes exciting opportunities to evolve a developer ecosystem which enables Toast engineers and external partners to continue to deliver excellent products on top of a reliable and sustainable platform. This role will help define, design, build, and maintain software solutions which advance developer effectiveness at Toast and provide a world-class experience to engineers across the business.

We’re growing a developer-focused team and looking for a Staff Software Engineer to provide technical leadership and mentorship within the team. The team focuses on delivering internal tooling to make developer’s lives easy. This role will focus on testing related tools and infrastructure, as part of a broader initiative to shift left on testing. Problems to solve could range from better mocking/fakes to test data management, from microservice test environment configuration to mobile device management.

Your day-to-day will be a mixture of writing code versus providing big picture guidance and technical leadership across the Testing Infrastructure engineers. You will act as a force multiplier for the team.

About this roll* (Responsibilities)

  • Design, build and maintain tooling infrastructure to make software testing and development at Toast a delight
  • Mentor and guide your peers to deliver with excellence, while also learning from their diverse experiences
  • Collaborate with product and engineering leadership to set and evolve plans
  • Review code to ensure technical implementation meets functional requirements
  • Drive execution of complex technical projects with many stakeholders

Do you have the right ingredients*? (Requirements)

  • You are respectful, empathetic, and humble
  • You have a passion for making your peers more productive and efficient
  • You have a growth mindset with an emphasis on learning and self/team-improvement
  • You have a bias towards action, with the ability to balance between getting things done and making things perfect
  • You are organized, and enjoy collaborating with and leading other engineers to produce great outcomes
  • 8+ years of software engineering experience in object-oriented languages
  • 2+ years exposure to Test Automation or DevOps/SREs, with concepts such as data management, build pipelines and metrics.

Our Spread* of Total Rewards:

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Sabbatical opportunity after five years

title: Product Marketing Manager, Solution & Product Enablement
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

Who we are

About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About the team

Product Marketing (PMM) is a global team of user-oriented marketers, partnering closely with many of Stripe’s world-class teams including product, engineering, integrated marketing, communications, and design.

Our Product Marketing team’s mission is to generate customer insights that inform Stripe’s product strategy, lead go-to-market for our suite of products, and create and execute campaigns to drive product growth

Product Marketing is a highly cross-functional role at Stripe, partnering closely with Product and Engineering, Sales, Design, Developer Relations, and Communications to name a few

Our team works across the entire product lifecycle, from helping shape the product, to driving launch and commercialization, to growing product adoption Post-launch

What you’ll do

We’re looking for a Product Marketer leader who will lead our solution and product sales enablement team for PMM globally to help align product marketing to the entire Sales organization and drive greater outcomes for Stripe.

This role will be responsible for leading, shaping, organizing enhancing go-to-market facing enablement programs that originate from within Product Marketing. You will be working closely with PMMs on Tier-1 launch enablement, ensuring key market moments are integrated into global campaigns, shaping quarterly sales-play plans and representing product marketing in deciding sales enablement priorities. This role will be a central point of contact, partnering across the PMM and Global Sales Enablement (GSE) teams.

Located on US west-coast, reporting to International PMM Leader

Responsibilities

  • Manage a small team who act as the single point of contact (DRI) for product enablement initiatives for PMM.
  • You will operate as a ‘player-coach’; setting the strategy and executing the programs. Leading (and building) our PMM Enablement team and developing other stripes.
  • This role will lead, shape, organise and enhance solution product-based enablement programs (and certifications) to help sales create higher quality opportunities, boosting average deal size win-rate
  • Partner closely with PMMs on major launches (and impact how we improve them), ensuring we have aligned enablement activities, sales plays and deal support material published
  • Works alongside PMM leadership to collate, assess, review and prioritise product enablement-related content, creation distribution. Assists in the delivery of content when required
  • Understand what the sales organisation needs in terms of content to help them to become onboarded, enabled and high-performing
  • Sets the tone, templates, standards and best practices to be used in the development of product content
  • Partner with the GSE team to track and analyse the right metrics and execute programs that drive awareness and education on an ongoing basis.
  • Ensure continuous improvement and relevance of global enablement programs, content and tools by monitoring results and establishing an effective feedback loop with GSE, sales, key stakeholders and subject matter experts

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

  • Track record of leading and developing talented people.
  • Tenacious. You ‘act like an owner’, are able to originate initiatives and work collaboratively and cross-functionally with your colleagues to deliver optimal outcomes for our team.
  • A storyteller. You have excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • You have deep empathy for sellers and are able to adapt how you communicate to best reach and engage this audience—from AEs to technical and non-technical sales roles
  • Data-oriented. You like working with data and insights and pair that with your passion for users to generate balanced and thoughtful points of view for how to take our products to market
  • Organised. You are able to build, champion and manage highly interdependent, complex projects and keep various work streams on track
  • Passionate about technology. You are keen to learn about how things work and are able to explain technical concepts in ways that everyday people can understand
  • Ambitious. You are eager to make an impact at Stripe. You thrive in a fast-moving environment and working with passionate sales teams, are able to operate fluidly between the 30,000-foot strategy level and the micro-detail to get things right
  • A collaborative team player. Product Marketers collaborate across the wider Marketing team, PR, product, sales, comms and basically with every team at Stripe. You are able to work with a range of disciplines to execute on your work
  • Optionally, knowledgeable about payments. You have an understanding of the network of partners and stakeholders in the payments ecosystem, and are excited about telling the story of how Stripe’s platform is differentiated within this space

Requirements

  • 7+ years of work experience that includes 3+ years direct ownership within at least two relevant functions, from sales enablement, sales, product marketing, product management, pre-sales, or strategy consulting
  • 2+ years of experience in managing and developing people
  • Prior experience working on enablement programs with the sales channel, and can demonstrate examples

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working in B2B settings and with sales teams
  • Experience in the fintech space working closely with product development, sales, and partnership team

Originally posted on Himalayas

'}]

title: Senior Employment Counsel
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

The worldwide data management software market is massive (IDC forecasts it to be $137.6 billion by 2026!). At MongoDB we are transforming industries and empowering developers to build amazing apps that people use every day. We are the leading modern data platform and the first database provider to IPO in over 20 years. Join our team and be at the forefront of innovation and creativity.

We are looking to add a Senior Employment Counsel to join the MongoDB Legal team. We are looking for an exceptional lawyer who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and isn't afraid of lofty goals and challenges. To succeed in this position, you must be able to work independently and efficiently. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing legal team and work on cutting edge issues.. MongoDB is growing rapidly, and every person we hire has the opportunity to help shape the business and grow with the company. We also make sure to have fun while we resolve issues. This is a full-time position and can be based in the USA.

This role can be based remotely in the North America region.

Responsibilities

  • Provide counseling and support to our Employee Experience team, HR Business Partners and the business on employee contracts, terminations, performance management, investigations, accommodations, reorganizations, and other employment-related matter
  • Along with other executives and lawyers, help shape the Company’s overall approach to people management
  • Collaborate with other lawyers on the team with respect to advice and counseling provided to HR and other cross-functional partners
  • Coordinate and manage employment related projects, including internal process reviews, new policy roll-outs and implementation, and training programs
  • Draft and edit employment-related documents, correspondence, agreements, processes and policies
  • Manage legal risks and provide solutions for resolving employment disputes
  • Participate in the creation and delivery of trainings related to employment law matters, such as harassment training and other manager trainings on a variety of topics
  • Manage and drive strategy on pre-litigation and litigation matters
  • Build and manage relationships with external counsel in jurisdictions around the globe

Requirements

  • Licensed in an appropriate jurisdiction
  • 7+ years of experience in labour and employment law
  • Employment litigation experience and experience coordinating and driving large-scale projects to completion (including litigations)
  • Smart, passionate and driven
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Enjoy working hard in a fast-paced environment and overcoming challenges
  • Great leadership and teamwork skills and willingness to take on new responsibilities
  • Experience advancing projects in a multi-stakeholder environment and handling and prioritizing multiple projects

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Jr. Sales Development Representative
description:
[{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://himalayas.app/jobs/rss', 'value': '

Who is Vivi

As an EdTech start-up, we are audaciously changing classroom engagement globally by helping educators achieve more through smarter technology use.

Our features are crowd-sourced directly from teachers because we share their passion for delivering solutions that have a real impact and improve educational outcomes. In fact, our solution is the only wireless presenting platform in the world built exclusively for the education sector.

Vivi is jam-packed with passionate people determined to make a difference. We encourage innovative thinking from change-makers with bucketloads of enthusiasm, because we believe bold ideas are the best ideas.

In four years, we’ve acquired over 800 customers, our software is in more than 60,000 classrooms and is used by over 130,000 active users. We have established clear product market fit and the business is now ready to scale.

The Opportunity

Reporting to the Sales Development Manager, your primary role will be to generate new opportunities through outbound calls, emails and social media. You will drive interest in the Vivi solution and hold high-level conversations with key faculty contacts about their current in-classroom technology strategies and identify how Vivi can add value to their staff and students! This role has advancement potential within our sales organization and offers a commensurate salary and uncapped commissions.

Responsibilities

  • Research and identify the right individuals at school districts and generate conversations to understand their needs and goals
  • Clearly articulate the Vivi value proposition to District administrators
  • Run prospecting campaigns into selected territories
  • Bring new prospecting ideas to the table, get creative!

Required Skills

  • Positive attitude, energetic and a desire to exceed sales objectives
  • Excellent phone, written and verbal skills
  • Well organized with efficient time management skills
  • Relevant sales experience

Bonus Points

  • Previous experience as an educator
  • Previous experience working in the EdTech market
  • Experience with CRM’s and sales automation tools

What Are Excited to Offer You

  • Commensurate Salary
  • A comprehensive benefit package
    • including wellness days off, TalkSpace and subsidized ClassPass subscription
  • The opportunity to give back to the community through our Volunteer program (2 days off for volunteer work per year)
  • Generous PTO flexible scheduling
    • Including your birthday off each year!
  • Career progression – we offer each employee an annual budget to assist with furthering their skills!

EEO Statement: Vivi is an equal opportunity employer. This means we are committed to recruiting, training, compensating and promoting our employees regardless of Race, Color, Ancestry, National Origin, Religion, Creed, Age, Disability, Sex, Gender, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Gender expression, Medical condition, Genetic Information, Marital status, or Military or veteran status. As an education technology organization, we are dedicated to reflecting the diversity, multiculturalism, and inclusion found in our consumers, employees, and partners. Inclusion is at the heart of what we do, from the way we craft our job descriptions, to the values we champion daily.

#li-remote
